Check for model convergence to asymptotic dynamics

Source: R/internal-lin_alg.R, R/utils-export.R
check_convergence.Rd

Checks for convergence to asymptotic dynamics numerically and visually. is_conv_to_asymptotic checks whether lambda[iterations - 1] equals lambda[iterations] within the specified tolerance, tolerance. conv_plot plots the time series of lambda (or log(lambda).

is_conv_to_asymptotic(ipm, tolerance)

conv_plot(ipm, iterations, log, show_stable, ...)

# S3 method for ipmr_ipm
conv_plot(ipm, iterations = NULL, log = FALSE, show_stable = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

ipm

An object returned by make_ipm().
tolerance

The tolerance for convergence.
iterations

The range of iterations to plot lambda for. The default is every iteration.
log

A logical indicating whether log transform lambda.
show_stable

A logical indicating whether or not to draw a line indicating population stability at lambda = 1.
...

Further arguments to plot.

Value

is_conv_to_asymptotic: Either TRUE or FALSE. conv_plot: codeipm invisibly.

Details

Plotting can be controlled by passing additional graphing parameters to ....

Examples

data(gen_di_det_ex)

proto <- gen_di_det_ex$proto_ipm %>%
  define_pop_state(n_ht = runif(200),
                   n_b  = 200000)

ipm <- make_ipm(proto)

is_conv_to_asymptotic(ipm, tol = 1e-5)
#> lambda 
#>   TRUE 
conv_plot(ipm)
